title: The rivalry between Vlad and Darius
body:
Well something that many people noticed is that {{champion:8}}  and {{champion:122}}  are listed as rivals on their champion pages.
However there is no real explanation for it.

However now with the new Sion relaunch I think that there might be a connection.
On the sion teaser site we see how Vlad reawakens sion(seems to be more of a mind manipulation considering that sion was this way when he got imprisoned)
So I think,that maybe Darius hates Vlad because he blames him for what happened to Sion?Thinking that Vlad messed up and is the reason for Sions current state.

Just a theory of mine.

replies.body: That's possible, but I'm still trying to figure out if Vlad was there for Sion's first resurrection, or for Swain's version. How old are these two men?

> That's possible, but I'm still trying to figure out if Vlad was there for Sion's first resurrection, or for Swain's version. How old are these two men?

For all intents and purposes Vladimir is a vampire.  I mean, he uses blood magic, and if you bother (I don't know why you would) to look up blood magic which is a variation of necrotic magic...you can extend your life (or at least age your physical appearance) more slowly.

With that said, despite how..."youthful" Vladimir looks, he may be as old as Swain if not even older.  And I mean, "way" older.

Oh, and I can agree with the theory put forth. I mean, Vlad just made Darius's predecessor (and possible inspiration, role model, hero) into a mindless, undead behemoth.  I'd be rather pissed about it.
I wouldn't be surprised if the blood kept him young, but feels sorta ineffective regarding the several ways other characters maintain their youth.

Such as? Nobody knows what Evelynn is, all the undead champions are rather gross and undead, Elise deliberately keeps her method a secret, and if LeBlanc's method was known to anyone other than her, it would be far more commonly used.

Well I think Leblanc simply doesn't keep her youth.
The leblanc in the first parts of the sion-teaser-site was probably her predecessor and she may keep her appearance through illusionary magic.

Thinking about it,I'd actually say it'd be really cool that if they give Leblanc a VU,that she'll show her true face during her passive(as in she has no longer the energy to keep that face),might be some mighty fan-disservice though

LeBlanc actually IS that young. She possesses her successors, merging her mind with theirs and adopting their form. She probably picks women that look like her in the first place.

But who knows, maybe that got retconned as well with the new lore overhaul.

Right now, the lore is too fluid to say anything for sure. What I'm doing is assuming everything has been retconned, and that we'll see some parts of the old character lore merging with mostly new stuff.
You sure about her possessing people? Figured LeBlanc the name was just a symbol for the current leader.

If her Champion Judgment still holds true in its biographic aspects, the identity of LeBlanc is indeed something which is passed off through the brooch in her hair.
I meant to say immortal, because we have Ascended, Iceborn, necromancy, and regardless of what secret Elise has, it's implied that she needs sacrifices and her spider god.

> I wouldn't be surprised if the blood kept him young, but feels sorta ineffective regarding the several ways other characters maintain their youth.

Hey, everybody can't get bit by a radioactive spider and expect to have the ability to shoot webs out of their wrist.

It could be very possible that Darius would have a grudge against Vladimir for awakening/brainwashing Sion. To have your childhood hero be brought back and twisted into a monster could be quite devastating. To Vlad's credit, at least Sion isn't just a mindless indiscriminate killing machine anymore.
